participant_abstract.sent: I presented trends in fashion and asked whether we could incorporate them in the design of the product.
I was not convinced myself that some of the trends were desirable to incorporate, and the group confirmed this.
The industrial designer told us about the options for the components for the remote, and what his preferences were.
The user interface designer showed us a few remotes and possible niche markets for remotes, and that we should avoid ambiguity in button design.
The project manager suggested we make decisions after each presentation, but in the end we made our final decisions after the three presentations.

participant_actions.sent: I will be focussing on the product evaluation - what do people think of the design we have come up with?
The design team will be building a prototype out of plasticine to show us at the next meeting.
The project manager will be going through the minutes and formulating an agenda for the next meeting.

participant_decisions.sent: We decided on various design aspects.
The remote should be a single curve, for sleekness.
It should have rubber buttons and a rubber case.
There should be voice recognition - but just to find the remote, not for functions.
The standby button should be fashonable - probably in the shape of an apple, and red in colour.
The other buttons should be a simple shape, with simple labels.

participant_problems.sent: The project manager got tied up in typing up the minutes and couldn't give a proper presentation.
The fashion trends that I found were somewhat ridiculous, and I felt a bit silly presenting them.
It was unclear what component options were compatible with which circuit board - i.e. did the voice recognition require a more advanced circuit?
Issues came up which would have influenced previous meetings - the distinctions between the meetings feel a little arbitrary.
